snippet: More than 1,000 birch-bark documents have been uncovered after being preserved for hundreds of years in the magical mud of Veliky Novgorod.
abstract: Veliky Novgorod Journal; dozens of birch-bark documents have been found during 2014 digging season in Veliky Novgorod, Russia; find adds to collection of more than 1,000 such documents uncovered there after being preserved for hundreds of years; mud that surrounds area makes city one of the most extraordinary archaeological sites on earth.
lead_paragraph: More than 1,000 birch-bark documents have been uncovered after being preserved for hundreds of years in the magical mud of Veliky Novgorod.

headline.main: Where Mud Is Archaeological Gold, Russian History Grew on Trees
headline.print_headline: Where Mud Is Archaeological Gold, Russian History Grew on Trees
